intro: Psychotria pilosella subsp. erythrotricha, commonly known as the red-haired psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The subspecies is distinguished by its reddish pubescence on the stems and leaves, contributing to its common name.
